title: Bookmarks and Browsing History Not Longer Displayed (version 141.0)
content:
Just updated from version 140.0.4 to version 141.0 and all my bookmarks AND browsing history are gone! I do see the appropriate files in my Firefox profile folder.

I tried following the instructions in the "Fix "The bookmarks and history system will not be functional" error message" article (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/fix-bookmarks-and-history-will-not-be-functional?as=u&utm_source=inproduct&redirectslug=The+bookmarks+and+history+system+will+not+be+functional&redirectlocale=en-US), but they are not correct, i.e., Solution 3: Update Security Software definitions does not apply as I have Defender turned off in favor of using ZoneAlarm. And those instructions say to update the definition, but there's not place to update the definitions.

I tried to import bookmarks from the Bookmarks folder, but when I click on "Choose file", Firefox either does nothing or shuts down without displaying any error.

100% disappointed with this update!

title: Since I installed the Firefox 141.0 update I can't login to Reddit #2
content:
Hello, I'm reporting this issue for the 2nd time in as many days because it appeared to have corrected itself late yesterday, but is back again today.

In a nutshell, installing the new Firefox 141.0 update conflicts with the Reddit login procedure making it impossible to do so. Here is the issue as reported yesterday for more detail:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1524793

I followed the suggestions I was given, i.e. to try logging in at the Old Reddit site (https://old.reddit.com/r/firefox/) and to disable my Adblock Plus extension, neither of which worked.

BTW, I tried logging into Reddit using another browser and it works fine.

So I performed another System Restore to eliminate the Firefox 141.0 update, then went into Firefox Settings and disabled "Automatically install updates", and can log into Reddit again with no problem.

Firefox is my preferred browser and Reddit is my preferred social media site, so I'll have to stop updating Firefox from this point on unless and until the developers correct the issue, or someone can provide insight into what's causing this and what to do about it.

Below are screen shots of the Reddit notices I get when trying to login with the Firefox 141.0 update installed:

content:
I am using Firefox 141.0 (64-bit) on Windows 11.

When I watch a video on Firefox (say, on YouTube,) the first watch-through is fine. When I restart the video, the audio desyncs with the video. For instance, if the person in the video says a word, and that word normally appears on screen simultaneously, in Firefox, it takes a second or two for the person to say the word. If I back the video all the way to the beginning manually, and then press play, it works fine.

I've disabled Hardware Acceleration in order to try and fix it, but it didn't work. I would appreciate any help with this.

Thanks in advance.

title: All tabs completely lost. Tabs are NOT synced
content:
I was working away on copying some files, nothing to do with Firefox. Firefox was open, though I hadn't used it in several minutes. Upon returning to Firefox, I noticed that although my browser had been open, it was not open anymore. All that was open was the download window.

At times in the past, I've accidentally closed the browser window while the download window was still open. I thought maybe this was what had happened this time, even though I absolutely didn't do that. I closed the download window and clicked on the icon on my desktop to restart it.

And that was when I discovered...no more tabs. Not a single one. Just a plain single blank tab.

In searching for an answer, I found this page: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1396868 but in my confusion and horror and anxiety over needing to get the tabs restored, I had missed this part: "Assuming you found the .html file, it should indicate which .jsonlz4 file it was listing out. Is that the file you want to roll back to (the .jsonlz4 file, not the HTML file)?" and I had started to follow the procedure below it, and after renaming the two files as specified, I realized...I don't have a file to restore.

And so now I have nothing. I don't know how to restore my tabs at all. I literally have no access to anything, because all was tied up in those tabs. How do I restore them? I did find another procedure elsewhere that used "History" and "Restore previous session," but the problem with that solution is that in the "History" there's no such option at all. (This is where I found that one.) https://www.bleepingworld.com/restore-previous-session-firefox/

I'm so afraid to try anything now, I haven't had this problem in years and now I'm totally lost and afraid to mess this up more.

As for the browser I'm writing about, it's the latest Firefox, as I have it set to automatically update. OS is w10.

Also, I only have sync set for passwords. I don't have it set for tabs, for the reason that I use different ones on different devices.

Please, please, help!

Thanks in advance.

title: Text in header <th> cells not visible (plus other font issues)
content:
Myself and a colleague who both use Firefox on Mac are experiencing the exact same issues.

1. Table header cells don't show their text, unless we specify a font for the table

I tried to put an example of the HTML here but it was rendered as a table by this page. I'll add some images of the code instead to show it.

In Firefox the Header cells are not visible, but in Chrome the text appears correctly.

If we add CSS like...

<style> table { font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; } </style>

...in the header then the missing text in the THs appears.


2. Other font issues

The Wave accessibility extension has text that doesn't appear and throw errors like this in the console...

downloadable font: rejected by sanitizer (font-family: "Open Sans" style:normal weight:400 stretch:100 src index:3) source: moz-extension://b86260c9-33f6-4529-b12f-a101d8607bd4/styles/open-sans-v17-latin-regular.woff

These only occur on Firefox on our Macs. Fine on PC and other browsers on the Macs.

We tried a whole series of tweaks to settings to try fix this.


I have tried resetting Firefox and doing a fresh install but nothing fixes either issue. Are these known issues with recent Firefox releases on Mac?
creator: darrenj1

title: Screenshot tool ignores custom save location and defaults to Downloads
content:
I'm using Firefox on macOS, and I'm having a persistent issue with the built-in screenshot tool. 

   When I take a screenshot using the right-click → "Take Screenshot" option, Firefox always saves the image to the Downloads folder, even though I’ve changed the setting in about:config to use a different save location. 
   I've tried modifying: 
       browser.download.dir to a custom folder 
       browser.download.useDownloadDir → true or false (I've tested both) 
   Despite these changes, Firefox continues to ignore the custom path and always saves screenshots in the default Downloads folder. 
   I’d like to know: 
       Is this a known issue? 
       Is there a working method to change the default save folder for screenshots? 
       Or is the screenshot tool hardcoded to use Downloads regardless of configuration?

Thanks in advance for your help.
